item.title: Lessons From A Reality-Show 'Master': Every Entrepreneur Should Copy These 5 Strategies For Success - Forbes Now
item.description:
Lessons From A Reality-Show 'Master': Every Entrepreneur Should Copy These 5 Strategies For Success  Forbes Now

Entrepreneur and reality star Pete Nelson. Image courtesy Nelson Treehouse & Design. Pete Nelson isn’t just building treehouses—he’s building a business empire. Nelson is perhaps best known as the lively host of the hit Animal Planet show Treehouse Masters, now in its seventh season. Before (literally) building a treehouse empire, Nelson considered himself equal parts entrepreneur and hobbyist. “Building treehouses has always been a lifestyle for me,” he told me earlier this month. “Being a carpenter and designer, I thought, ‘How can I possibly be paid to do this?’ It’s almost like it’s too...

item.title: New Zealand rugby union player in coma after on-field cardiac arrest - The Guardian
item.description:
New Zealand rugby union player in coma after on-field cardiac arrest  The Guardian

A New Zealand rugby union player is in an induced coma after suffering a cardiac arrest during a local match. Bevan Moody, 22, collapsed and stopped breathing 15 minutes before the end of Waitohi’s first division Tasman Trophy match against Nelson at Neale Park on Saturday. He was treated on the pitch by team management and then paramedics for 30 minutes before being transferred to Nelson hospital. Related: Young New Zealand rugby union player dies following on-field injury The Tasman Rugby Union (TRU) said it was “deeply saddened” by the news. “Our thoughts and hearts are with Bevan’s fami...

item.title: The ultimate New Zealand road trip - CNN
item.description:
The ultimate New Zealand road trip  CNN

A road trip is the best way to appreciate New Zealand, as you can cover many of its highlights over the course of a week. We've curated the ultimate New Zealand road trip, encompassing wine-growing regions, cultural and historical sites and places of unforgettable natural beauty. North Island The northernmost point of New Zealand, Cape Reinga, where the Tasman Sea meets the Pacific Ocean. courtesy bernard spragg/flickr/creative commons Auckland to Northland and the Bay of Islands Follow State Highway One north from Auckland to Kerikeri, catching the car ferry to Russell at Opua then returni...

item.title: Monaco Grand Prix 2017: Nelson Piquet Jr.'s dream weekend in Principality - CNN
item.description:
Monaco Grand Prix 2017: Nelson Piquet Jr.'s dream weekend in Principality  CNN

Monaco is a home from home for a number of leading motorsport drivers and of course once a year they even get to race around the Principality's racing circuit, either in Formula One or Formula E. So who better than Formula E driver Nelson Piquet Jr -- the son of triple F1 world champion Nelson -- to provide a lowdown on spending a dream weekend in Monaco. "A perfect week would be racing in Monaco -- and winning a race," Nelson Piquet Jr. told CNN. Then, if there's one thing F1 drivers know how to do well, it's celebrate. Piquet's nightclub of choice is Jimmy'z, the self-titled "Monte-Carlo ...

item.title: Why You Need To Go To Weird And Wonderful New Zealand - Forbes Now
item.description:
Why You Need To Go To Weird And Wonderful New Zealand  Forbes Now

By Dawn Hagin for Fathom | If you ever get the chance to visit New Zealand, you might as well justify that long flight with three weeks of hang time — at least. The better to enjoy the mystical landscapes, top-notch food, and sheep as far as the eye can see. Dawn Hagin, chief inspiration officer at Lark Hotels, just returned from a memorable holiday. Giant boulders strewn around the hillside at Castle Hill. All photos by Adam Policky. So, what brought you to New Zealand? I visited expat friends who live in Golden Bay — the northwestern area of the South Island — but also made time to explor...

item.title: New Zealand: where to go - The Telegraph
item.description:
New Zealand: where to go  The Telegraph

An essential guide to where to go in New Zealand, including what to do in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch, and how to visit Hawke's Bay, Rotorua, Marlborough, Mount Cook, Milford Sound and Hokitika Gorge. By Sarah Bennett, Lee Slater and Bryne Reade Telegraph Travel's New Zealand experts. Auckland & Northland New Zealand’s largest city is a green and leafy metropolis, spread over old volcanoes and wrapped around two harbours thus earning it the moniker ‘the city of sails’. As well as lively cultural and hospitality hubs downtown and dotted throughout its suburbs, Auckland offers plent...

item.title: A walk across NZ: Governors Bay - 500px
item.description:
A walk across NZ: Governors Bay  500px

While rushing from Nelson to Picton to catch the ferry back to the North Island, I drove through one of the most scenic and beautiful road I ever seen: Queen Charlotte Drive. This jaw dropping scenery was taken in the Grove Arm of the majestic Queen Charlotte Sound (Totaranui in Māori).

item.title: Lake Wanaka, New Zealand - 500px
item.description:
Lake Wanaka, New Zealand  500px

One of the many beautiful scenes in New Zealand's South Island.I took this on a drive down the West Coast from Nelson to Queenstown. The whole drive is just amazingly scenic at every turn.

item.title: Tahunanui Beach View - 500px
item.description:
Tahunanui Beach View  500px

This is the view that you get from Tahunanui Beach looking towards Nelson Harbour and Fifeshire Rock. I was lucky that the air was very still on this day so that the water had a really nice glassy look and the clouds added a moody sky.

item.title: Glendaun Glow - 500px
item.description:
Glendaun Glow  500px

Taken on the banks if the Glendaun, Nelson New Zealand. Was a last minute trip to this place and also my first time here, ended up being a dramatic sunset and managed to quickly find a composition.

item.title: New Zealand's best beaches in photos - CNN
item.description:
New Zealand's best beaches in photos  CNN

Awaroa, Tasman: Situated deep in the Abel Tasman National Park, this secluded area at the top of the South Island was bought by thousands of Kiwis as part of a crowd-funding campaign so that it would stay open to the public. Nelson.com Moeraki, Otago: The sands of Moeraki are famous for a group of large spherical boulders, located along Koekohe Beach, which were formed from ancient sea sediments millions of years ago. Courtesy Mike Hollman New Chums Beach, Waikato: One of the last undeveloped beaches in New Zealand, this protected bay can only be reached by boat or a 30-minute clamber from ...

item.title: New Zealand Tourists Trapped by Storm Freed, Road Cleared - VOA News
item.description:
New Zealand Tourists Trapped by Storm Freed, Road Cleared  VOA News

Hundreds of tourists trapped in a remote New Zealand town for 48 hours after a strong storm damaged roads were freed Saturday after authorities cleared a highway. About 600 tourists are now able to leave the remote town of Haast, 426 km (265 miles) northwest of Dunedin on the west coast of the South Island, a world heritage area famous for rugged scenery, after the road was cleared. State Highway Six reopened at 11 a.m., the NZ Transport Agency told Reuters in an email. “All stranded motorists have now been able to leave,” it said. The road was hit by landslides as wild weather from former ...

item.title: Discovering the 'four prongs of wellness' at New Zealand's most luxurious lifestyle retreat - The Telegraph
item.description:
Discovering the 'four prongs of wellness' at New Zealand's most luxurious lifestyle retreat  The Telegraph

An assortment of colours twist and turn before my eyes as though I’m peering through a kaleidoscope. My body feels featherweight, content in a state of relaxed paralysis. Slowly the psychedelic jamboree on my eyelids cartwheels into the darkness and the lullaby of the meditation tape starts to fade. I keep my eyes shut, basking in a feeling of complete peace. I had arrived at Split Apple Retreat the day before, having driven from Nelson on New Zealand’s South Island. Ducking under the wooden archway in the garden, I’d struck the gong to summon owners Lee and Pen to the door, and was soon we...

item.title: New Zealand road trip: hills, chills and thrills in the top of the South - The Guardian
item.description:
New Zealand road trip: hills, chills and thrills in the top of the South  The Guardian

“People come here and say they drove in Australia and the scenery didn’t change all day. In New Zealand it changes around every damn bend!” This is Noel, who runs the Wine, Art & Wilderness tour company in Nelson, in the far north of NZ’s South Island. When I meet him I’ve just spent a week with my boyfriend Gavin driving the Top of the South touring route, from quake-hit Christchurch and whale-watching hub Kaikoura, through alpine terrain and the country’s biggest wine region, to end in this city famed for art, food and sunshine. We’ve jet boated through rapids, bathed in thermal pools, bi...

item.title: Ancient Ice - 500px
item.description:
Ancient Ice  500px

I had to do an airport drop off in Nelson then a 225am pickup in Christchurch 9 days later... so what to do in between. Seventeen years passport free, the south island is enough for me. Left home at 7am and was feeling very free and at a loose end driving out of Nelson at 920am. Stopped in Ashburton for provisions and a stretch then cruised out west to the Mackenzie, passing the wind scuffed blue of burgeoning Tekapo as bridal gowns flew on the wind. But evening calm set in as I romped along the trail in time to catch this icey little number down at Tasman Lake. Loved the contrast from lusc...
